titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Death Valley days : videotape series
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff, Vishnu Jani.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-08-11T13:29-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: August 11, 2014: Completed finding aid; April 23, 2014: Added description for reformatted film. April 11, 2014: Added description for reformatted film.

physdesc.extent: 7 motion picture film reels (1 cubic foot box)

did.abstract: Motion picture film of selected episodes of the Western television series, of which Ronald Reagan was host.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Death Valley days : videotape series, Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1983.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Motion picture film of selected episodes of the Western television series, of which Ronald Reagan was host.

did.unittitle: Call of the West, "No Gun Behind His Badge," 16mm film

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Use copy available on-site for immediate use. Use copy reference number: 83093_f_0011199.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Episode 22 of the 13th season of the anthology series "Death Valley Days." This program, under the syndicated series title "Call of the West," "No Gun Behind His Badge" is hosted by John Payne and stars Ronald Reagan. Written by Robert Hardy Andrews. Produced by Robert Stabler. Starring Ronald Reagan, Barry Kelley, Shary Marchall, Woodrow Parfrey, Mort Mills, Leo Gordon, Michael Witney, Glenn Stensel, Quentin Sondergaard, and Ed Madden.

did.unittitle: Call of the West, "Temporary Warden," 16mm film

accessrestrict.head: Publication Rights
accessrestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Episode 1 of the 14th season of the anthology series "Death Valley Days." This program, under the syndicated series title "Call of the West," "Temporary Warden" is hosted by Robert Taylor and stars Ronald Reagan. Written by Todhunter Ballard and Robert Leslie Bellem. Directed by Harmon Jones. Starring Ronald Reagan, Charles Francisco, George Murdock, Jim Bannon, and Rodolfo Acosta.

did.unittitle: Call of the West, "A City is Born," 16mm film

accessrestrict.head: Publication Rights
accessrestrict.p: Use copy available on-site for immediate use. Use copy reference number: 83093_f_0011033.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Episode 8 of 14th season of the anthology series "Death Valley Days." This program, under the syndicated series title "Call of the West," "A City is Born" is hosted by John Payne and stars Ronald Reagan. Written by Robert Leslie Bellem and Todhunter Ballard. Produced by Robert Stabler. Starring Ronald Reagan, Jack Lambert, James Seay, Michael Davis, Oscar Beregi, and Robert Carricart.

did.unittitle: Call of the West, "Battle of San Francisco Bay," 16mm film

accessrestrict.head: Publication Rights
accessrestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Episode 20 of 13th season of the anthology series "Death Valley Days." This program, under the syndicated series title "Call of the West," "Battle of San Francisco Bay" is hosted by Robert Taylor and stars Ronald Reagan. Written by Robert Hardy Andrews based on an article by Jerry MacMullen. Directed by Jack Shea. Starring Ronald Reagan, June Dayton, William Bramley, and Hal Torey.

did.unittitle: Call of the West, "No Place For a Lady," 16mm film

accessrestrict.head: Publication Rights
accessrestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Episode 7 of 14th season of the anthology series "Death Valley Days." This program, under the syndicated series title "Call of the West," "No Place For a Lady" is hosted by Robert Taylor and stars Ronald Reagan, Maidie Norman, Simon Scott, Linda Marsh, and Joel Fluellen.

did.unittitle: Call of the West, "The Lawless Have Laws," 16mm film

accessrestrict.head: Publication Rights
accessrestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Episode 3 of 14th season of the anthology series "Death Valley Days." This program, under the syndicated series title "Call of the West," "The Lawless Have Laws" is written by Robert Hardy Andrews, produced by Robert Stabler and directed by Tay Garnett. The program is hosted by John Payne and stars Ronald Reagan, Shary Marshall, and Tim McIntire.

did.unittitle: Call of the West, "Tribute to a Dog," 16mm film

accessrestrict.head: Publication Rights
accessrestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Episode 9 of 13th season of the anthology series "Death Valley Days." This program, under the syndicated series title "Call of the West," "Tribute to a Dog" is written by Lance Hazzard, produced by Robert Stabler, and directed by Harmon Jones. The program is hosted by John Payne and stars Ronald Reagan, Charles Cooper, S. John Launer, Ralph Moody, Kay Stewart, and William Zuckert.
